intro: Euphrasia pseudokerneri f. elongata, commonly known as the elongated eyebright, is a botanical variant of the eyebright plant. It is a herbaceous perennial native to parts of Europe and Asia. The plant features small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in the spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, typical of the Scrophulariaceae family. This form is distinguished by its longer stems compared to the typical species, making it a notable variation in the genus Euphrasia.
